Authors:
Yuan-Shuai Liu, Jian-Kui Liu, Jaturong - Kumla, Saisamorn
Lumyong
Title: Two new Amanita species in section Amanita from Thailand
Keywords:
Amanitaceae; Diversity; Multi-gene; Taxonomy; Two new
species
Abstract:
Based on a survey of macro-fungi in northern and
northeastern Thailand, nine samples collected in 2020 are identified as
Amanita and introduced here as two new species, Amanita kalasininus and
A. ravicrocina. Typical macro- and microscopical characteristics
indicate that both of these two species belong to Amanita section
Amanita but differ from other species. Amanita kalasininus is
characterized by having a greyish yellow pileus covering with a conical
to granuliform, yel-lowish white volval remnant; the presence of clamps,
and a broadly ellipsoid to ellipsoid basidi-ospore. Amanita ravicrocina
is characterized by having a brown to greyish orange pileus covering
with a patchy, white volval remnant; a collar-like volval remnant on the
stipe, and a subglobose to broadly ellipsoid basidiospore. Multi-gene
phylogenetic analysis of partial nuclear rDNA in-ternal transcribed
spacers regions (ITS), partial nuclear rDNA large subunit region
(nrLSU), RNA polymerase II second largest subunit (RPB2), partial
translation elongation factor 1-alpha (TEF1-Î±) and beta-tubulin gene
(TUB) also revealed that positions of A. kalasininus and A. ravi-crocina
are well-supported within A. section Amanita, but form as distinct
lineages and do not show any close relationship with any species. The
detailed morphological features, line-drawing illustration and
comparison with morphological similar taxa are provided.
